content: Can someone explain ₓ in plain English, and maybe post to the wiki?
when the types of the Lean3 statement and the Lean4 statement aren't exactly equal, we append the name with this.
I notice that jump-to-definition works even on the align statements with ₓ, which is mysterious to me
It seems generally impossible for a human to get these ₓs right
I think the idea is that we need to flag that the declarations don't match somehow, to make it easier to debug errors which might show up later
